thank you so so much!! my favourite tips to share would be to keep track of your usage, triggers and symptoms as you start to come off of them. what really helped me push through the first few days was distractions, and methods of delay. filling my days up with activities that took my mind off of it. even shit as stupid as bleaching my hair or curling it, or reorganising my kitchen cabinets. watching loads of movie to past the time was also really helpful. itâ€™s a slow and agonising process, especially at first, so itâ€™s okay to allow yourself to feel the shitty and treat yourself to low energy activities.  
as for methods of delay, when i feel like relapsing, i tell myself to wait 5 minutes, then 15, and so on, until i either forget, find a distraction, or normally fall asleep. or iâ€™ll put on a movie and say â€œi wonâ€™t take it now, but iâ€™ll watch this movie and then decide if i want to do it when itâ€™s finishedâ€ and by the end of it usually i managed to curb the urge.  
exercising when you feel the urge over the course of the day was super super helpful too, particularly stuff focused on core strength. it would give me a nice buzz and by the end of it iâ€™d feel so worn out that the idea of taking stuff would make me feel a bit sick. itâ€™s also nice to see yourself build up more toned features over the course of even a few days of intense exercise. adrenaline filled activities are good.  
i use melatonin to help with the insomnia, itâ€™s been particularly bad recently (havenâ€™t slept in literally 3 days) but itâ€™s comforting to know i have it as a safety net just in case the insomnia is really bad.  
the app â€œi am soberâ€ has really helped me to keep track of my usage, and my withdrawal symptoms. you can log positive and negative symptoms as you reach each milestone (1 day, 3 days, 1 week, 2 weeks, 1 month etc). it also sends positive notifications! couldnâ€™t recommend it enough. seeing how many days iâ€™ve been sober for pushes me to hang on for at least another day.  
you got this friend. i believe in you. iâ€™m so proud of you for being here. youâ€™re more than welcome to pm me if you wanna talk. i got you!
